questions.question_text:
You must deploy several Oracle 19c databases on an Oracle Grid Infrastructure Managed Cluster, and are required to have the ability to perform these actions without down time:
1. Apply a Grid Infrastructure interim patch.
2. Apply a Grid Infrastructure Patch Set Update (PSU).
3. Apply a database on-line patch.
4. Apply a Grid Infrastructure patchset.
5. Apply a database patchset.
6. Upgrade Grid Infrastructure from one release to another.
7. Upgrade databases from one release to another.
Your plan is to perform these tasks:
1. Install and configure Oracle Grid Infrastructure on a local file system.
2. Install Oracle Database software on an ACFS file system.
3. Create several RAC One Node databases.
Which of the seven requirements are met by your plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: F
ZERO DOWNTIME UPGRADE is possible

Selected Answer: E
I think 6 is OK - upgrade grid with zero downtime for 19c databases is possible
I am not sure about patchsets (for 19c we use RU).
I bet E

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about ASM Cloud File System (ACFS) auditing? (Choose three.)

choices.C: acfsutil audit purge can be run by an audit manager.
choices.D: Audit information gathered by each cluster node can be consolidated into the unified ACFS audit trail.
choices.A: acfsutil audit read marks audit files to indicate that it is safe to purge them.
choices.B: acfsutil audit init must be run by a system administrator.
choices.E: acfsutil audit archive must be used to archive audit files that are larger than 10 MB.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
I think D is wrong
A - correct - 
acfsutil audit read
Marks the audit trail to indicates to the audit manager that the log archive file for the current node has been reviewed, backed up as necessary, and is safe to purge.

questions.question_text:
You support a RAC database with these characteristics:
1. There are six instances.
2. Server Pool prod has a maximum of four servers.
3. CRM is a policy managed, uniform service using Server Pool prod.
4. ERP is a policy managed, singleton service using Server Pool prod.
5. Grid infrastructure is installed and running in its default configuration.
Which four benefits are provided by this configuration in Oracle 19c? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACFG
D is wrong - there are only three scan listeners (by default and recommended)
F is correct (there is only singleton service but connection can be load balanced across three scan listeners)

choices.E: Load balancing of connection requests for ERP across all database instances running on servers in the prod pool
choices.C: High availability for the ERP service
choices.G: Load balancing of connection requests for CRM across all database instances running on servers in the prod pool
choices.A: High availability for the CRM service
choices.B: Load balancing of connection requests across all six database instances
choices.D: Load balancing of client connection requests for CRM across four Single Client Access Name (SCAN) listeners
choices.F: Load balancing of client connection requests for ERP across three Single Client Access Name (SCAN) listeners

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about Instance Locks in Oracle 19c RAC? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A. They are used to coordinate access across multiple library caches for the same stored procedure. True
In RAC, Instance Locks are used to synchronize access across multiple library caches, ensuring that shared resources like stored procedures are correctly synchronized across instances.
D: They are used when an application uses the DBMS_LOCK package for UL lock types. TRUE
Instance Locks are utilized when applications use the DBMS_LOCK package for user-defined locks (UL), allowing coordination and synchronization among different instances in an Oracle RAC environment.

Selected Answer: CD
C. Instance locks are used to coordinate the generation of sequence numbers when a sequence is created with the CACHE and ORDER clauses to ensure consistency across multiple instances in a RAC environment.
D. The DBMS_LOCK package can be used to create user-defined locks (UL locks), and these locks are managed as instance locks in a RAC environment to ensure synchronization.

choices.A: They are used to coordinate access across multiple library caches for the same stored procedure.
choices.E: They are used to coordinate the next value for a sequence created with the NOCACHE and NOORDER clauses.
choices.B: They are used to coordinate access across multiple library caches for anonymous PL/SQL execution.
choices.D: They are used when an application uses the DBMS_LOCK package for UL lock types.
choices.C: They are used to coordinate the next value for a sequence created with the CACHE and ORDER clauses.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the Global Enqueue Service, Instance Locks, and global enqueues in Oracle 19c RAC? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Sure of BC

B,C ,
Both rac & rac one node havelmd0 backgroup process.

choices.B: Global Enqueues may have converters and waiters in the same instance.
choices.D: Global Enqueues and Instance Locks replace latches completely in RAC database instances.
choices.F: In a RAC One Node database, there is no LMD0 process if only one instance is running.
choices.C: Global Enqueues may have owners and waiters in the same instance.
choices.A: Global Enqueues and Instance Locks replace mutexes completely in RAC database instances.
choices.E: In a RAC database, there is no LMD0 process if only one instance is running.
